description:
Wickerhamomyces anomalus NRRL Y-366-8 is a species of yeast that belongs to the phylum Ascomycota, class Saccharomycetes, and the family Saccharomycetaceae. It is a single-celled, eukaryotic microorganism that reproduces asexually through budding.

The strain NRRL Y-366-8 is a specific isolate of this species, which was deposited in the Agricultural Research Service Culture Collection (NRRL) maintained by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA).

Wickerhamomyces anomalus is known for its versatile metabolic capabilities, including the ability to ferment a wide range of carbohydrates, produce ethanol, and degrade various organic compounds. It has been used in various industrial applications, such as the production of enzymes, biofuels, and biocontrol agents.

The strain NRRL Y-366-8 may have distinct physiological or genetic characteristics compared to other isolates of the same species, which could make it suitable for specific research or industrial purposes. However, without further detailed information about this particular strain, it is difficult to provide a more comprehensive scientific description.
